item.title: OONI Analysis of Telegram Blocking in Kenya During the 2023 and 2024 KCSE Exams
item.description:
This report supported a petition filed at the High Court of Kenya in May 2025, challenging the unlawful disruption of internet access in Kenya. OONI data is used as evidence in support of this landmark public interest case. Learn more here.

    • Introduction
    • Summary of Findings
      • 2023 KCSE exams: Blocking of Telegram
      • 2024 KCSE exams: Blocking of Telegram
    • About OONI
    • OONIâ€™s Internet Measurement Methodology
      • Telegram experiment
      • Web Connectivity experiment
      • Data analysis
        • Acknowledgement of limitations
    • OONI measurements from Kenya
    • Findings: Blocking of Telegram in Kenya during 2023 and 2024 KCSE exams
      • 2023 KCSE exams: Blocking of Telegram in Kenya
        • Blocking of Telegram website
        • Blocking of Telegram Web
        • Blocking of Telegram app endpoints
      • 2024 KCSE exams: Blocking of Telegram in Kenya
        • Blocking of Telegram website
        • Blocking of Telegram app endpoints
        • Blocking of Telegram Web
    • Conclusion

Introduction

Access to Telegram was blocked in Kenya during the Kenya Certificate of Secondary Education (KCSE) national exams in both November 2023 and November 2024. This report provides an analysis by the Open Observatory of Network Interference (OONI) Foundation on these blocks.

item.title: Kenya: Censorship-free internet?
item.description: Over the last five months we ran OONI tests in Kenya almost every day to examine whether internet censorship events were occurring in the country. Hundreds of thousands of network measurements were collected and analyzed. 1,357 URLs were tested for censorship, including both international websites and sites that are more relevant to Kenya (e.g. local news outlets). Yet, after five months of intensive testing from four local vantage points in Kenya, we found almost no signs of internet censorship in the country.
